message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.HC, cs.MM

The paper deals with the extraction of a statistical model of the human tongue from 3D MRI data, which involves image segmentation, template fitting, image denoising, and palate surface information reconstruction. These techniques are commonly used in computer vision and machine learning, which suggests that the paper could belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) or Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Moreover, the paper focuses on the analysis of speech-related vocal tract configurations, which involves natural language processing and speech recognition, indicating that it could also belong to the Computation and Language (cs.CL) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the generation of a plausible tongue animation by tracking sparse motion capture data, which involves computer graphics and multimedia (cs.MM) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.HC, and cs.MM, in descending order of likelihood.
